workflow.name: Automate bounce email management for lead generation with Gmail and NocoDB
workflow.description:
# üì¨ SPAM MANAGER FOR LEAD GENERATION

Automatically identifies and manages spam replies from your outreach inbox; such as ‚ÄúDelivery failed‚Äù or ‚ÄúThere was a problem with your delivery‚Äù which comes from "mailer-daemon@googlemail.com" for Gmail. This is to remove these messages to keep your email lists clean and improve domain reputation.

---

## üéØ Who it‚Äôs for

This workflow is designed for **lead generation managers, outreach specialists, and freelancers** who send cold or automated emails at scale.

It helps you **automatically filter and manage bounce or spam responses** without manually combing through your inbox, ensuring your sender domain stays healthy and your lead lists remain accurate.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it works

1. **Trigger:** Watches your Gmail inbox for replies from system senders like `mailer-daemon@googlemail.com`.  
2. **Extract Email:** Pulls out the email address from each bounce or spam message.  
3. **Merge:** Compares the extracted address with your **main lead sheet**.  
4. **Update Sheet:**  
   - If the email exists in your main sheet, it updates that record‚Äôs **SPAM field** to `"YES"`.  
   - Otherwise, it adds the address to a dedicated **Unsubscribe or Bad Emails table**.  
5. **Mark as Read:** Tags and marks the email as processed in Gmail for better visibility.

---

## üß© Requirements

To run this workflow, you‚Äôll need:
- **Gmail Credentials** ‚Üí For reading and tagging emails.  
- **NocoDB API Token** ‚Üí For reading and updating your lead list and spam records.(You can use Sheets, Airtable or any other DB you use).  

Both can be securely added through the **n8n Credentials Manager**.

---

## üß† How to Customize

- **Sender Filter:** Change the Gmail Trigger to include other mailer domains or error messages.  
- **Data Storage:** Replace NocoDB with Google Sheets or Airtable.  
- **Tagging:** Adjust or remove the Gmail label used for spam-marked messages.  
- **Message Matching:** Edit the `MERGE` code node to fit your column names (e.g., `Email`, `Address`, etc.).  

---

## üí° Why this workflow matters

By automating spam and bounce handling, you:
- Keep your **lead database clean and current**  
- Reduce bounce rates and spam flags  
- Improve your **email deliverability and sender score**  
- Save time spent manually checking failed emails  

---

## ü™Ñ Quick Setup Tips

- Add your Gmail and DB credentials under the **Credentials tab**.  
- Update the DB project and table IDs in relevant nodes.  
- Test with a few known bounce messages to verify connection and matching.  
- Optional: Add a ‚ÄúSPAM‚Äù tag in Gmail for quick inbox filtering. "UNSUBSCRIBE" is used in this workflow.  

---


## üßæ Workflow Info

**Workflow Name:** SPAM MANAGER FOR LEAD GENERATION  
**Category:** Email & Data Hygiene  
**Version:** 1.0  
**Created for:** Outreach and CRM Automation  


---

**Author:** Itunu  
**Portfolio:** [Itunu‚Äôs Automation Portfolio](https://github.com/E2nuu/itunu-automation-portfolio)

parameters.content:
### Step 1: GMAIL TRIGGER

‚Å†->Monitors your Gmail inbox for bounce or spam messages (like mailer-daemon replies) and extracts the email to compare with your MAIN outreach sheet

### Step 3:  CHECK SPAM STATUS
-> If the email has already been marked as spam, do nothing; else move on to add the "SPAM" tag

### Step 5: GMAIL TAG
-> Adds "Unsubscribe" and/or "Spam" in GMAIL
->Marks as read in GMAIL

## SPAM MANAGER FOR LEAD GENERATION




## HOW?

This workflow keeps your sender reputation high 

by removing dead, blocked, and invalid emails before they drag down your 

campaigns.

Every ‚ÄúDelivery failed‚Äù or ‚ÄúMailbox full‚Äù reply is caught and logged 

automatically ensuring you only contact real, active prospects.





## SETUP STEPS

-->Connect Gmail credentials & node

-->Connect NocoDB API token/Google Sheets

-->Have a column in your sheets for "SPAM" and "SPAM DATE"

--> Create a new sheet just for "SPAM" emails, this helps you cross 

reference with other sheets in the future.

-->Follow the steps highlighted and then test the workflow

### Step 2: MERGE

‚Å†->Merge email from the GMAIl node with the emails in your MAIN outreach sheet

### Step 4:  CHECK SPAM STATUS
->Add the "SPAM" tag to the MAIN outreach sheet and also create a copy of the contact in your SPAM sheet

nodes.name: UPDATE SPAM NAME IN MAIN OUTREACH SHEET
ADD UNSUBSCRIBE AND/OR SPAM TAG TO EMAIL

main.node: UPDATE SPAM NAME IN MAIN OUTREACH SHEET
ADD UNSUBSCRIBE AND/OR SPAM TAG TO EMAIL

user.name: Itunu
user.bio: Automation consultant helping businesses turn repetitive tasks into scalable workflows with n8n. I design, optimize, and deploy automations that save time and boost productivity; so you can focus on growth, not grunt work.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
